title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is interviewed about coordinated inauthentic behavior and disinformation, particularly related to COVID-19 in Italy. He discusses how actors adapt to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior and the challenges of analyzing disinformation campaigns.
description: This is a podcast interview with Fabio Giglietto about coordinated inauthentic behavior and disinformation, specifically related to COVID-19 in Italy. He discusses actor adaptation to platform crackdowns and the challenges of disinformation analysis.

title: "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS" - YouTube
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino which demonstrates how META has favored homophobic, racist, or outright fake news posts at the expense of content from politicians.
description: A YouTube video discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto regarding META's algorithm promoting homophobic, racist, and fake news posts.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Meno contenuti politici nei feed, la stretta di Meta è stata meno efficace contro gli estremisti - Il Sole 24 ORE
description: News article from Il Sole 24 ORE

title: Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme - Open
snippet: Reports on a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino analyzing the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the distribution and visibility of political content on Facebook. The study found that Meta's policy of reducing political content has led to a decrease in visibility for institutional politicians, while extremist, anti-European, pro-Russian, and conspiracy-theory content has increased.
description: The article reports on a study by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino about the impact of Facebook's algorithms on political content visibility, specifically how it affects institutional politicians versus extremist content.

title: Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil in October 2025. He presented research on using large language models to analyze political discourse in Facebook groups and moderated a roundtable on data access in the context of the Digital Services Act. Also mentioned is his collaborative work with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni.
description: This article from vera.ai reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil in October 2025, discussing his research on disinformation and digital manipulation, including the use of large language models for analyzing political discourse and data access within the Digital Services Act.

title: Cambio di Rotta - Cap3: La Fluidità del Voto in Italia 2022 - Studocu
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: Fabio Giglietto leads the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team within the vera.ai project, which focuses on developing AI-based tools to combat disinformation. The team coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4) within the vera.ai project.
description: This web mention discusses Fabio Giglietto's role as the leader of the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team within the vera.ai project, which focuses on combating disinformation using AI, aligning with his expertise in social media research and misinformation detection.
